A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Even the strength of Luke couldn't turn this ship all the way around.  A pointless flail of expensive (yet\, somehow\, cheap-looking) CGI that no amount of tacked-on quips\, or even Carrie Fisher's luminescent star power\, can rescue.   It's just a repetitive\, goofy smash-a-thon that lacks the character development that made EMPIRE STRIKES BACK so great (also a vastly better film). A hasty\, disjointed assemblage of two conflicting visions; a bad movie fused to a different bad movie.  For all the fracas\, this is a curiously inert piece of action filmmaking. The dialogue borders on the cheesy with intermittent leaps headlong into the cheddar.
